title: Mesut Ozil sends classy message to Lukas Podolski after former Arsenal star enters international retirement
text:
Lukas Podolski scored the winning goal against England on his last appearance for Germany (Picture: Getty) Mesut Ozil sent former Arsenal teammate Lukas Podolski a classy message following the Germany legend’s fairy tale international exit.
Revealed: What Joe Hart said to Lukas Podolski after thunderbolt for Germany Podolski scored the winning goal, a trademark thunderbolt, on his 130th and final appearance for the national side as Joachim Low’s team enjoyed a 1-0 win over England in Dortmund.
The 31-year-old, who ended his international career which spanned 13 years with 49 goals, is due to leave Galatasary for Japanese side Vissel Kobe at the end of the current season.
Ozil and Podolski played at club level together for 18 months at Arsenal and on numerous occasions for Die Mannschaft, and the former Real Madrid star, along with current Gunners teammate Shkodran Mustafi, admitted they will miss the presence of the charismatic forward.
All the best, Abi! We'll miss you, bro! @Podolski10 #GAZVER #AHA #TschöPoldi pic.twitter.com/8ufeGx8wlY 
— Mesut Özil (@MesutOzil1088) March 22, 2017 
Good win ⚽ and much more important a massive last game for @Podolski10 ! You will be missed! #TschöPoldi #GERENG pic.twitter.com/utZhPBkwNP 
— Shkodran Mustafi (@MustafiOfficial) March 22, 2017 

Ozil missed the victory over Gareth Southgate’s much-changed England team with the same hamstring injury which ruled him out of Arsenal’s Premier League defeat against West Brom last weekend.
‘They have minor hamstring injuries but it is too much of a risk to play them,’ Low confirmed ahead of the game, referring to his injured trio of Ozil, Manuel Neuer and Mario Gomez.
